# Pacolet Mills Cloth Room and Warehouse

| locmapin             = South Carolina#USA
| built                = -1907
| architect OR builder =
| architecture         = Late 19th And Early 20th Century American Movements
| added                = February 1, 2006

Pacolet Mills Cloth Room and Warehouse is a historic textile mill located at Pacolet, Spartanburg County, South Carolina. It was built in 1906â€“1907, and consists the 1 1/2-story, brick cloth building with the attached warehouse portion covered with weatherboard and metal. the building features a low-profiled roof and large rounded arch windows. The front portion of the building was used for inspecting cloth prior to shipping, and the rear portion was used as a warehouse.
It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 2006.
